alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:59PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ada, southwestern Boise and west central Elmore Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Blacks Creek Reservoir, or 12 miles southeast of Boise, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Southeastern Boise around 500 PM MDT. Lucky Peak Dam, Lucky Peak Spring Shores Marina, Lucky Peak Reservoir and Aldape Summit around 510 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southwestern Idaho.
